title: "History and Practice of Magnetic Inductions in Alchemy"
first_phrase: In the previous section, we learned about the history and practice of magnetic inductions, which developed from alchemical practices of the "third level." These inductions simplified the process by separating the active and passive elements into two people, allowing the operator to take an active role and the subject to remain passive. While effective in therapy, this approach has limitations and maintains a dualistic state. In the final 200 tokens, we discover how an operator can use the intense field created to achieve transcendence and direct energy vertically, reducing the need for harmonization exercises while minimizing the risk of pathological overflow.
content: Può avere dei limiti per lo sviluppo della presenza e rischia di mantenere sempre in uno stato di “dualità” a meno che l’operatore stesso non sfrutti l’intenso campo creato per realizzare uno stato di trascendenza dirigendo l’energia verticalmente (ma deve conoscere le tecniche ed il percorso di questo libro per farlo non accidentalmente). Specializzandosi in una sola posizione vi è però il vantaggio che si ha bisogno di meno energia per iniziare. Questo rende meno necessari allora gli esercizi di armonizzazione preventiva in quanto vi è meno energia e meno rischio di debordamento patologico.
last_phrase: In conclusion, mastering the techniques presented in this book is crucial to avoid the limitations and risks associated with the development of magnetic inductions. Specializing in a single position requires less energy and lowers the need for preventive exercises. By redirecting the energy vertically, one can achieve a transcendental state and trigger a powerful psychic change by sending vitality back to the operator. Remember, the speed of the swap should increase to create a resonant effect.
